title: Example script
code: rm(list = ls()) library(modelLong)  # Load example longitudinal data (must be of long format) URL <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alejandroh3005/longitudinal-data/main/data/cdc-birthwt.csv" data <- read.csv(URL) # Define binary group variable data$"Low weight" <- as.factor(ifelse(data$bweight < 1200, 1, 0))

title: Example script
code: # Summarize data in Table 1, stratify summary by low weight status # Exclude Mother and Child ID in data summary summary_res <- modelLong::summary(data = data[-c(1, 5)],                                   group_var = "Low weight") summary_res$table1

title: Example script
code: # Create plots of repeated measures and ACF plot_res <- modelLong::plot(data = data,                             outcome = "bweight",                             time = "mage",                             id = "mid",                             col_group = "Low weight") plot_res$data_plot plot_res$acf_plot

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hernandez AD (2024). modelLong: Model visualize longitudinal data. R package version 1.0, https://alejandroh3005.github.io/modelLong/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {modelLong: Model and visualize longitudinal data},   author = {Alejandro Dionicio Hernandez},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {https://alejandroh3005.github.io/modelLong/}, }

title: Model and visualize longitudinal data
text: package fitting generalized linear mixed-effects models (GLMM) generalized estimating equations (GEE). also functions visualize longitudinal data. URL GitHub (.e., source code) : https://github.com/alejandroh3005/modelLong URL Pkgdown webpage : https://alejandroh3005.github.io/

title: Model and visualize longitudinal data
text: package called modelLong. install, run following code (R): Upon completion, can run following code (R):

title: Model and visualize longitudinal data
text: package depends following packages: dplyr, ggplot2, gtsummary, nlme, geepack.

title: Model and visualize longitudinal data
text: Thank Dr. Kevin Lin kind instruction encouragement!

what: Plot ACF and repeated measures — plot
title: Plot ACF and repeated measures — plot
text: Creates two GGPlot objects visualize (1) repeated measures time, option color observations group; (2) autocorrelation function (ACF). data argument must long format. generated plot data may manipulated (multiple facets, additional layers, etc.).

title: Plot ACF and repeated measures — plot
Plot ACF and repeated measures — plot
code: data <- read.csv(   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alejandroh3005/longitudinal-data/main/data/cdc-birthwt.csv") data$"Low weight" <- as.factor(ifelse(data$bweight < 1200, 1, 0)) plot_res <- plot(data = data,                  outcome = "bweight",                  time = "mage",                  id = "mid",                  col_group = "Low weight") #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union plot_res$data_plot  plot_res$acf_plot

what: Generate Table 1 summary by group — summary
title: Generate Table 1 summary by group — summary
text: Generates Table 1 style summary data, option variable stratify results. generated tables include overall summary statistics.

title: Generate Table 1 summary by group — summary
Generate Table 1 summary by group — summary
code: data <- read.csv(   "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/alejandroh3005/longitudinal-data/main/data/cdc-birthwt.csv") data <- data[c("border", "bweight", "mage")] data$"Low weight" <- as.factor(ifelse(data$bweight < 1200, 1, 0)) summary_res <- summary(data = data, group_var = "Low weight") summary_res$table1     Variable       Overall N = 4,3901                Low weight            0 N = 4,3601       1 N = 301     border       1 878 (20%) 870 (20%) 8 (27%)    2 878 (20%) 874 (20%) 4 (13%)    3 878 (20%) 873 (20%) 5 (17%)    4 878 (20%) 870 (20%) 8 (27%)    5 878 (20%) 873 (20%) 5 (17%)bweight 3,156 (2,850, 3,515) 3,172 (2,863, 3,515) 854 (680, 1,090)mage 22 (18, 24) 22 (18, 24) 21 (18, 24)1 n (%); Mean (Q1, Q3)
